all_questions.question: What is the true distribution of output words at every time stamp in the parral corpora?
all_questions.context: Our parral corpora for a given input sentence do not contain the set of all possible translations.

all_questions.question: How is the output distribution defined for each time step?
all_questions.context: We'll say that this output distribution is set to 1 for the word which was seen at this position in the training data and for 0 to all other candidate tokens.

all_questions.question: What is the purpose of defining an output distribution as peaked?
all_questions.context: So we define these output distributions very simply. We will say that this output distribution is set to 1 for the word which was seen at this position in the training data and for 0 to all other candidate tokens.

all_questions.question: What is meant by saying that the defined output distribution 'is not nice'?
all_questions.context: So we define these output distributions very simply. It is not nice. It just tells you this is the word that you were expected to produce.

all_questions.question: What does the comparison to 'ugly from...' suggest about the nature of the output distribution?
